sub_title: Director at Ecorys International Development Unit
summary:
International Development Consultant with strong understanding of development cooperation and a proven track record of succesful proposal writing. Main focus areas are International Relations, Governance (PFM), Civil Society, Capacity Building and creating development opportunities. Within Ecorys responsible for building and managing our project portfolio in (east) Africa. Lot Sector Lead for Civil Society under the EU FWC "Services for the Implementation of External Aid‚Äù Lot 3 - Human Rights, Democracy and Peace.

Extensive experience in managing large Technical Assistance and Capacity Building programs. I am currently working in South Africa on the Procurement, Infrastructure and Knowledge management Capacity Development programme (PINK-CD) as well as the Civil Society Facility in South Sudan. Before that I was working at the EU-TAPP project in South Sudan as Performance Management Specialist. 

Demonstrated ability in establishing strong intercultural communication and working relationships with a wide range of stakeholders at all levels. Being an optimist, networker, communicator and real team player, I am always looking for new opportunities in Africa and other parts of the world!

projects:
[{'title': 'Technical Assistance to the Tanzania Public Finance Management Reform Project (PFMRP5)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': None, 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan-Willem', 'last_name': 'Knippels', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Ecorys International Development Unit'}]}, {'title': 'Technical Assistance for the formulation and management of CSO initiatives and activities in Agriculture and Social Protection', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'This service contract will assist the contracting authority with the implementation of the CSO-RISE programme to foster initiatives of the civil society organisations in their capacities to address economic, social and climate-resilient issues through innovative interventions contributing to the sustainable management of ecosystems and for the empowerment of women in some districts of Ghana with financial assistance from the European Development Fund (EDF). Ecorys activities include the support to the evaluation of proposals, monitoring and evaluation of Grants, knowledge management and communication with third parties including dissemination of best practices.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan-Willem', 'last_name': 'Knippels', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Ecorys International Development Unit'}]}, {'title': 'Procurement, Infrastructure and Knowledge management Capacity Development programme (PINK-CD) in South Africa', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'The overall objective of this program is to increase cost effective, socially inclusive and sustainable service delivery at provincial and local government level. To achieve this objective, the programme is aligned with the priorities of the National Treasury to address  weak procurement practices and poor infrastructure management. These are considered main causes of irregular, fruitless and wasteful expenditure on basic service delivery within municipalities. 

The overall objective will be achieved through two complementary key result areas (KRA):
KRA 1 ‚Äì More effective supply chain management (procurement) at local government level.
KRA 2 ‚Äì Enhanced infrastructure management (budgeting, planning and asset management) at local government level.

While the ultimate impact of the programme will be at local government level, both KRAs include support to National Treasury and some Provincial Treasuries to strengthen them in their (constitutional and legal) role to provide support to the municipalities. Both KRAs also rely heavily on knowledge management and peer learning, which, together with Ecorys support are included as cross-cutting activities for both KRAs.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan-Willem', 'last_name': 'Knippels', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Ecorys International Development Unit'}]}, {'title': 'Technical Assistance for Sub-national Capacity Building in Payroll and PFM: Extension and Bridging Phase', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'At the end of 2015, the EU established an EU emergency trust fund for stability and addressing the root causes of irregular migration and displaced persons in Africa. In December 2015, the Board of the Trust Fund approved additional "Support to stabilisation through improved resource, economic and financial management in South Sudan". In the context of the uncertain direction of PFM reform and decentralisation in South Sudan, the extention and bridging phase contract provides for an extension of the EUTAPP programme to ensure that past good practices are continued, while monitoring the evolution of the situation in the country.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan-Willem', 'last_name': 'Knippels', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Ecorys International Development Unit'}]}, {'title': 'Consulting Services for a Vulnerability Analysis and Feasibility Study for the city of Barisal', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Project manager and backstopper for the this Pilot project of KfW in Bangladesh.

The first objective of the study is to conduct a spatial and economic analysis of Barisal‚Äôs vulnerability to climate change and climate variability and to carry out an economic analysis of different adaptation options. It has two sub objectives:
‚Ä¢	assess in economic and spatial terms the vulnerability and hazard risks posed by climate change (notable related to sea level rise, rain, river discharge, storm surge), and
‚Ä¢	assist the decision-making process for investments and adaptive measures through cost-benefit analysis and prioritization of activities and investments.

The second objective of the project is to assess a) the feasibility of preselected promising measures on technical, financial, cultural, institutional, environmental and other relevant aspects and b) to develop a project monitoring & evaluation plan as basis for KfW to decide on project funding. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan-Willem', 'last_name': 'Knippels', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Ecorys International Development Unit'}]}, {'title': 'Implementing Agency in support of a Project with the National Pensions Regulatory Authority (NPRA) of Ghana', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': "In 2008, Ghana overhauled the pension system and introduced a new contributory three pillar
pension system. The new system complies with international best practice and has similarities to the Swiss pension model. The National Pension Regulatory Authority (NPRA), a new organisation was tasked with the sector's development, oversight and regulation. Ecorys supports the NPRA in the implementation of the Swiss funded supprt Project. 

The fundamental objectives of the Project are to contribute to poverty reduction and economic development by supporting the implementation of a pension system that produces a reliable, adequate and secure old-age income for all citizens.
", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan-Willem', 'last_name': 'Knippels', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Ecorys International Development Unit'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Eric Kwamena', 'last_name': 'Davies, ASA, MAAA', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Managing Director, Davies Consulting, LLC'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ivo', 'last_name': 'Gijsberts', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director, International Development Unit at Ecorys'}]}, {'title': 'Technical Assistance for Sub-national Capacity Building in Payroll and PFM in South Sudan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': 'Project Manager for the ‚ÄòTechnical Assistance for Sub-national Capacity Building in Payroll and PFM in South Sudan‚Äô (EU-TAPP) which Ecorys is implementing in partnership with VNG International.

The purpose of this project is to build the capacity of local governments to more effectively provide basic social and economic services to the population. In addition, the project aims at promoting a decentralized system of governance in South Sudan.

Specifically the project will:
- Support local governments (States and counties) in meeting the requirements set out in the Local Government PFM Manual;
- Support the State in analysing current payrolls and separate state and county staff payrolls;
- Support County Administration Departments to properly manage payrolls and implement the South Sudan Electronic Payroll System Phase II (SSEPS II);
- Support the establishment and operation of the County Transfer Monitoring Committee (CTMC).

Within the project I am providing inputs as Performance Monitoring Expert towards our TA activities to the state and county level governments. For this I have designed a Measuring tool (M&E) to track country performance as well as the formulation of County Dashboards to communicate achievements but also remaining challenges. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan-Willem', 'last_name': 'Knippels', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Ecorys International Development Unit'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ivo', 'last_name': 'Gijsberts', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director, International Development Unit at Ecorys'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Don', 'last_name': 'Seufert', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Chief of Party | Team Leader PFMRP-V Ecorys-UK, FCDO Tanzania'}]}, {'title': 'Development of a Local Government HRM manual and Model Local Government Structure in South Sudan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'Project manager to support the development of an Interim Local Government HRM Manual to specifying the needed human resource practices to guide local governments in South Sudan.  Additionally, a Model Local Government Structure is being developed to elaborate the best practices of structuring local government for service delivery including local government functions, staffing levels, job descriptions, grading and reporting. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan-Willem', 'last_name': 'Knippels', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Ecorys International Development Unit'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ferdi', 'last_name': 'Konig', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Independent Public Sector expert focusing on developing countries in Africa.'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Frank', 'last_name': 'Kabwechere', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Independent Management Consultant'}]}, {'title': 'Capacity Building in Taxation in Dutch partner countries', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'Ecorys, together with IBFD, PBLQ HEC and VNG international provides technical advice and Technical Assistance to tax administrations in selected Dutch partner countries, based on requests received from the relevant tax administration.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan-Willem', 'last_name': 'Knippels', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Ecorys International Development Unit'}]}, {'title': 'Support to the Government Accountancy Training Centre (GATC fase II) in Juba, South Sudan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'Institutional capacity building of the GATC and assist the centre to provide PFM trainings to South-Sudanese civil servants. Roll-out of training on the Local Government PFM manual at the state level as well as selected counties.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan-Willem', 'last_name': 'Knippels', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Ecorys International Development Unit'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ivo', 'last_name': 'Gijsberts', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director, International Development Unit at Ecorys'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Chris', 'last_name': 'van Hemert', 'name': None, 'headline': 'üîóü§ù‚öô‚òï Verbinder | Kwartiermaker | Maatschappelijk betrokken | Voeten in de klei'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ross', 'last_name': 'Worthington PhD', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Chief of Party, USAID Ghana Performance Accountability Activity'}]}, {'title': 'Afghanistan Program Summative Evaluation', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'Project manager for the Canadian Development Development Agency (CIDA) Afghanistan Program Summative Evaluation. This evaluation will cover the whole project portfolio in the period 2004-2013 from a strategic and portfolio perspective.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan-Willem', 'last_name': 'Knippels', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Ecorys International Development Unit'}]}, {'title': 'Civil Society Facility South Sudan - Fund Manager & acting Team Leader', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'The Civil Society Facility (CSF) is a multi-donor fund supported by the Governments of the Netherlands, Norway and Sweden, with the Netherlands acting as the lead donor. Up to now, civil society organisations in South Sudan remained overwhelmingly dependent on meeting donors‚Äô programmatic priorities for financial support. The CSF aims to depart from this practice and build stronger organisations that deepen linkages with citizens and build up constituencies around certain thematic areas or for certain geographic locations. Civil society organisations have a central role to fulfil in mobilizing public opinion to increase influence on national, regional and local policies and demand greater accountability of use of public resources.

The initial phase of the CSF will run for five years and will have an initial budget of $20 million. An important aspect of the CSF is to provide grants to local civil society organizations to build up stronger organisations and alliances and to undertake governance and advocacy projects. Ecorys will set up the fund management system through four funding windows. As Fund Manager, Ecorys will take responsibility for devising and managing the grant application process, conducting due diligence checks, selection of grantees, overall financial management, output monitoring and reporting and capacity building of local organizations. In order deliver this suite of services Ecorys has teamed up with VNG International, the International NGO Training and Research Centre (INTRAC) and AKVO.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan-Willem', 'last_name': 'Knippels', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Ecorys International Development Unit'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ivo', 'last_name': 'Gijsberts', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director, International Development Unit at Ecorys'}]}, {'title': 'Consultant, Participatory Gendered Market Mapping & Adaptation OXFAM GB Tanzania', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'Oxfam aims to move as many smallholders as possible, particularly women into sustainable income generating agricultural using a market led approach called Gendered Enterprises and Marketing (GEM). I was responsible for conducting Participatory Gendered Market Mapping (PGMM) workshops to build the capacity and the ownership of the project stakeholders on promoting women‚Äôs economic leadership in the value chains of Rice, Sisal and Vegetables. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan-Willem', 'last_name': 'Knippels', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Ecorys International Development Unit'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Mshinwa Edith', 'last_name': 'Banzi', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Managing Director Beth Farms'}]}, {'title': 'Public Private Partnership "Forest garden tea" in Sri Lanka', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'This Public Private Partnership (PPP) was established as a model commercial venture that addresses the problems faced by the tea plantations sector by implementing a sustainable tea ecosystem, and promoting biodiversity and sustainable natural resources management in Sri Lanka and in other tea growing countries.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan-Willem', 'last_name': 'Knippels', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Ecorys International Development Unit'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Charith', 'last_name': 'Senanayake', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Sustainability and wellbeing.'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Bert-Jan', 'last_name': 'Ottens', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Owner & Senior Adviser, ProFound - Advisers In Development'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ranil', 'last_name': 'Senanayake', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Chairman at Earthrestoration'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Durka', 'last_name': 'Chellaram', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Managing Director at Greenfield Bio Plantations (Pvt) Limited'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Paul', 'last_name': 'Wolvekamp', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Both ENDS'}]}]
